        "body": "Would expect the following to work, but it seems like once **verify: false** is passed in it \"defaults\" to 443 and seems to ignore the passed in port.\r\n\r\n**$ response = HTTParty.get('https://localhost:3780', verify: false)**\r\n=> Errno::ECONNREFUSED: Connection refused - connect(2) for \"localhost\" port 443\r\n\r\nHowever, if i set the service to run on 443, everything works fine.\r\n\r\n**$ response = HTTParty.get('https://localhost', verify: false)**\r\n=> okay.\r\n\r\n\r\nruby 2.2.0p0 (2014-12-25 revision 49005) [x86_64-darwin13]\r\nhttparty (0.13.3)\r\n\r\nLet me know if there is any other information I can pass along."

        "body": "I want to implement getting remote ip for response host like this:\r\n```ruby\r\nresponse = HTTParty.get 'http://google.ru'\r\nresponse.remote_ip\r\n```\r\n```shell\r\n=> \"173.194.40.248\"\r\n```\r\nI don't find this ability in net/http lib, only in socket library.\r\nI am also, don't created tests, because i am not sure, that my implementation looks clearly.\r\n@jnunemaker , what you think about it ?",

        "title": "SSL verify: false Ignores Port",
        "user": {
          "login": "superscott",
          "id": 1940659,
          "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1940659?v=3",
          "gravatar_id": "",
          "url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott",
          "html_url": "https://github.com/superscott",
          "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/followers",
          "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/following{/other_user}",
          "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/gists{/gist_id}",
          "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
          "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/subscriptions",
          "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/orgs",
          "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/repos",
          "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/events{/privacy}",
          "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/superscott/received_events",
          "type": "User",
          "site_admin": false
        },
        "labels": [

        ],
        "state": "open",
        "locked": false,
        "assignee": null,
        "milestone": null,
        "comments": 1,
        "created_at": "2015-01-14T23:00:37Z",
        "updated_at": "2015-01-16T20:54:24Z",
        "closed_at": null,
        "body": "Would expect the following to work, but it seems like once **verify: false** is passed in it \"defaults\" to 443 and seems to ignore the passed in port.\r\n\r\n**$ response = HTTParty.get('https://localhost:3780', verify: false)**\r\n=> Errno::ECONNREFUSED: Connection refused - connect(2) for \"localhost\" port 443\r\n\r\nHowever, if i set the service to run on 443, everything works fine.\r\n\r\n**$ response = HTTParty.get('https://localhost', verify: false)**\r\n=> okay.\r\n\r\n\r\nruby 2.2.0p0 (2014-12-25 revision 49005) [x86_64-darwin13]\r\nhttparty (0.13.3)\r\n\r\nLet me know if there is any other information I can pass along."
      },

        "updated_at": "2015-01-16T20:54:23Z",
        "body": "@superscott , i can't reproduce it, may be you made mistake?\r\nIt looks, that behaviour is nice\r\nWithout port it tries to use default port\r\n```\r\n[11] pry(main)> HTTParty.get 'https://localhost', verify: false\r\nErrno::ECONNREFUSED: Connection refused - connect(2) for \"localhost\" port 443\r\nfrom /home/ruslan/.rbenv/versions/2.1.5/lib/ruby/2.1.0/net/http.rb:879:in `initialize'\r\n```\r\nAnd with port everuthing is ok\r\n```\r\n[9] pry(main)> HTTParty.get 'https://localhost:3780', verify: false\r\n=> \"<!DOCTYPE html>\\n<html>\\n  <head>\\n    <title>Ruby on Rails: Welcome aboard</title>\\n    <style media=\\\"screen\\\">\\n      body {\\n        margin: 0;\\n        margin-bottom: 25px;\\n        padding: 0;\\n        background-color: #f0f0f0;\\n        font-family: \\\"Lucida Grande\\\", \\\"Bitstream Vera Sans\\\", \\\"Verdana\\\";\\n        font-size: 13px;\\n        color: #333;\\n      }\\n\\n      h1 {\\n        font-size: 28px;\\n        color: #000;\\n      }\\n\\n      a  {color: #03c}\\n\\n      a:hover {\\n        background-color: #03c;\\n        color: white;\\n        text-decoration: none;\\n      }\\n\\n      #page {\\n        background-color: #f0f0f0;\\n        width: 750px;\\n        margin: 0;\\n        margin-left: auto;\\n        margin-right: auto;\\n      }\\n\\n      #content {\\n        float: left;\\n        background-color: white;\\n        border: 3px solid #aaa;\\n        border-top: none;\\n        padding: 25px;\\n        width: 500px;\\n      }\\n\\n      #sidebar {\\n        float: right;\\n        width: 175px;\\n      }\\n\\n      #footer {\\n        clear: both;\\n      }\\n\\n      #header, #about, #getting-started {\\n        padding-left: 75px;\\n        padding-right: 30px;\\n      }\\n\\n      #header {\\n        background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,[10] pry(main)> HTTParty.get 'https://localhost', verify: false\r\nErrno::ECONNREFUSED: Connection refused - connect(2) for \"localhost\" port 443\r\nfrom /home/ruslan/.rbenv/versions/2.1.5/lib/ruby/2.1.0/net/http.rb:879:in `initialize'\r\n[11] pry(main)> HTTParty.get 'https://localhost', verify: false\r\nErrno::ECONNREFUSED: Connection refused - connect(2) for \"localhost\" port 443\r\nfrom /home/ruslan/.rbenv/versions/2.1.5/lib/ruby/2.1.0/net/http.rb:879:in `initialize'\r\n[12] pry(main)> HTTParty.get 'https://localhost:3780', verify: false\r\n=> \"<!DOCTYPE html>\\n<html>\\n  <head>\\n    <title>Ruby on Rails: Welcome aboard</title>\\n    <style media=\\\"screen\\\">\\n      body {\\n        margin: 0;\\n        margin-bottom: 25px;\\n        padding: 0;\\n        background-color: #f0f0f0;\\n        font-family: \\\"Lucida Grande\\\", \\\"Bitstream Vera Sans\\\", \\\"Verdana\\\";\\n        font-size: 13px;\\n        color: #333;\\n      }\\n\\n      h1 {\\n        font-size: 28px;\\n        color: #000;\\n      }\\n\\n      a  {color: #03c}\\n\\n      a:hover {\\n        background-color: #03c;\\n        color: white;\\n        text-decoration: none;\\n      }\\n\\n      #page {\\n        background-color: #f0f0f0;\\n        width: 750px;\\n        margin: 0;\\n        margin-left: auto;\\n        margin-right: auto;\\n      }\\n\\n      #content {\\n        float: left;\\n        background-color: white;\\n        border: 3px solid #aaa;\\n        border-top: none;\\n        padding: 25px;\\n        width: 500px;\\n      }\\n\\n      #sidebar {\\n        float: right;\\n        width: 175px;\\n      }\\n\\n      #footer {\\n        clear: both;\\n      }\\n\\n      #header, #about, #getting-started {\\n        padding-left: 75px;\\n        padding-right: 30px;\\n      }\\n\\n      #header {\\n        background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,:\r\n```\r\nI am using the same version 0.13.3\r\n/cc @jnunemaker, @mikeastock "

    "payload": {
      "action": "created",
      "issue": {
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143",
        "labels_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143/labels{/name}",
        "comments_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143/comments",
        "events_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143/events",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143",
        "id": 4827339,
        "number": 143,
        "title": "Can't Marshal.dump HTTParty response for caching",
        "user": {
          "login": "ericboehs",
          "id": 28198,
          "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/28198?v=3",
          "gravatar_id": "",
          "url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs",
          "html_url": "https://github.com/ericboehs",
          "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/followers",
          "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/following{/other_user}",
          "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/gists{/gist_id}",
          "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
          "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/subscriptions",
          "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/orgs",
          "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/repos",
          "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/events{/privacy}",
          "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/ericboehs/received_events",
          "type": "User",
          "site_admin": false
        },
        "labels": [

        ],
        "state": "open",
        "locked": false,
        "assignee": null,
        "milestone": null,
        "comments": 9,
        "created_at": "2012-05-30T23:39:21Z",
        "updated_at": "2015-01-16T19:49:27Z",
        "closed_at": null,
        "body": "Since version 0.8.3 we can no longer serialize HTTParty responses for caching. I have narrowed it down to a single [commit](https://github.com/jnunemaker/httparty/commit/9fd5259c8dab00e426082b66af44ede2c9068f45). :)\n\nI believe this is because of the lambda { } on line 211 of request.rb (Procs/lambdas can't be serialized). Of course removing the lambda breaks the call on line 18. If this can be worked around I believe we have a fix.\n\nI have also wrote a test if it helps any:\n\n```\nit \"should be serailizable (for memcaching)\" do                                                                                                                                                         \n  FakeWeb.register_uri(:get, 'http://twitter.com/statuses/public_timeline.xml', :body => 'tweets')                                                                                                      \n  custom_parsed_response = @klass.get('http://twitter.com/statuses/public_timeline.xml')                                                                                                                \n  lambda do                                                                                                                                                                                             \n    Marshal.dump(custom_parsed_response)                                                                                                                                                                \n  end.should_not raise_error                                                                                                                                                                            \nend\n```\n\nI'm not sure how to fix this so I leave it up to you.\n\nThanks"
      },
      "comment": {
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/comments/70311309",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143#issuecomment-70311309",
        "issue_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143",
        "id": 70311309,
        "user": {
          "login": "rusikf",
          "id": 3082811,
          "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3082811?v=3",
          "gravatar_id": "",
          "url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf",
          "html_url": "https://github.com/rusikf",
          "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/followers",
          "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/following{/other_user}",
          "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/gists{/gist_id}",
          "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
          "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/subscriptions",
          "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/orgs",
          "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/repos",
          "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/events{/privacy}",
          "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/rusikf/received_events",
          "type": "User",
          "site_admin": false
        },
        "created_at": "2015-01-16T19:49:27Z",
        "updated_at": "2015-01-16T19:49:27Z",
        "body": "I agree with @ericboehs , you can't use lambda with Marshal.dump like this:\r\n```\r\n[2] pry(main)> Marshal.dump(lambda { puts '123' })\r\nTypeError: no _dump_data is defined for class Proc\r\n```\r\nIn normal case you can use some hooks, which are valid:\r\n```ruby\r\nserialized_block = %{lambda { puts '123' }}\r\nMarshal.dump(eval(serialized_block).call)\r\n```\r\nor you can use sourcify gem (use only latest 0.6.0.rc4 gem )\r\n```ruby\r\nrequire 'sourcify'\r\nl = lambda { puts '123' }\r\nserialized_block = l.to_source\r\nMarshal.dump(eval(serialized_block).call)\r\n```\r\n\r\nBut in this case, i don't find the solution, all attempts are failed because i get error, which can't debug\r\n```\r\nException: SystemStackError: stack level too deep\r\n```\r\nIt looks, here\r\n```ruby\r\n Response.new(self, last_response, lambda { parse_response(body) }, body: body)\r\n```\r\nparse_response have a complicated stack (Request.parse_response, Parser.call etc)\r\n@jnunemaker , what you think about it ? Do you have any ideas how to solve this issue?\r\nAlso, may be helpful for somebody will be 'updated test' in first message for current master: \r\n```ruby\r\nrequire File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..', 'spec_helper'))\r\n\r\nRSpec.describe \"HTTParty marshal\" do  \r\n  it \"should be serailizable (for memcaching)\" do \r\n    url = 'http://githubus.com'                                                                                                                                                        \r\n    FakeWeb.register_uri(:get, url, :body => 'tweets')                                                                                                      \r\n    response = HTTParty.get(url)   \r\n    expect { Marshal.dump(response) }.to_not raise_error                                                                                                                                                                        \r\n  end\r\nend\r\n```"
      }
    },
    "public": true,
    "created_at": "2015-01-16T19:49:27Z"
  },

    },

      "action": "started"
    },
    "public": true,
    "created_at": "2015-01-14T23:27:33Z"
  }
]
